DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Tissue Transfer Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Surgical Procedure Tissue Collection And Preservation Standard Operating Procedure Performed Deviation Descriptive Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Description of issues with the transport of tissue from the OR to the pathology gross room or deviations from the surgical tissue collection and preservation SOP.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Tissue Transfer Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Surgical Procedure Tissue Collection And Preservation Standard Operating Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another._A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact._An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Tissue Transfer Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Surgical Procedure Tissue Collection And Preservation Standard Operating Procedure Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.:A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.:An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.

A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.
An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text that provides a description of a topic.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
